SGBudget2025: The Home Team continues to do well in keeping Singapore safe and secure. Singaporeans remain confident in the Home Teams ability to carry out its mission fairly and effectively.To tackle new and evolving threats and security challenges, the Home Team will: Leverage technologies such as Artificial Intelligence for organisational effectiveness, equip our officers with the competencies to use them, and review our laws and regulatory frameworks to deal with crimes. Expand the foreign recruitment pool for Emergency Medical Services personnel and Auxiliary Police Officers with tight safeguards. Partner banks to strengthen their scam prevention measures and work on more ways to help people better identify potential scams. Strengthen Preventive Drug Education for youths, such as through schools and with parents. Fully operationalise Supervision 2.0 to enhance the supervision and reintegration of ex-drug abusers into society, as well as support the rehabilitation of inmates with initiatives that help them strengthen relationships with their families and enhance their chances for gainful employment.For more information, visit

[Overview of Safety and Security Situation in 2024]The Home Team continued to keep Singapore safe and secure in 2024. The number of physical crimes remained stable, and we have one of the lowest fire fatality rates in the world. Scams, as well as young drug abusers, are key concerns.We are committed to working together as one Home Team, and in partnership with you, to keep Singapore safe.Read more here: go.gov.sg/home-team-overview-2024 OneHomeTeam

Multi-racialism, underpinned by racial harmony, is a foundational principle for Singapore.The state of racial harmony in Singapore is strong, and the Maintenance of Racial Harmony Bill passed in Parliament on 4 February further strengthens our ability to safeguard our social cohesion.The Bill has five key proposals. It:1. ports over existing race-related offences in the Penal Code;2. introduces the Community Remedial Initiative;3. establishes a Restraining Order regime;4. establishes the Presidential Council for Racial and Religious Harmony to advise on matters relating to racial and religious harmony that are referred to it by the Minister for Home Affairs or by Parliament; and5. introduces safeguards against malicious foreign influence via race-based entities. Learn more about the second and third proposals in the images above.Read more:go.gov.sg/racial-harmony-bill-minister-speechgo.gov.sg/racial-harmony-bill-mos-speechgo.gov.sg/racial-harmony-bill-wrap-up

The Protection from Scams Bill empowers Police officers and Commercial Affairs officers to issue a Restriction Order (RO) to banks to restrict the banking transactions of an individual, if there is reason to believe that he/she will make money transfers to a scammer. The RO will only be issued as a last resort, if all other efforts to convince the individual have failed.

The Protection from Scams Bill empowers Police officers and Commercial Affairs officers to issue a Restriction Order (RO) to banks to restrict the banking transactions of an individual, if there is reason to believe that he/she will make money transfers to a scammer. The RO will only be issued as a last resort, if all other efforts to convince the individual have failed.

The Protection from Scams Bill empowers Police officers and Commercial Affairs officers to issue a Restriction Order (RO) to banks to restrict the banking transactions of an individual, if there is reason to believe that he/she will make money transfers to a scammer. The RO will only be issued as a last resort, if all other efforts to convince the individual have failed.

Receiving the Scholarship is not just an honour it is a commitment to make an immediate difference to the lives of Singaporeans. I am currently working on MHAs data policy. Since childhood days, Ive had the desire to be part of the uniform services and contribute to the security of our nation. These aspirations were fuelled by family and friends who had careers in SCDF, Prisons and SPF. When SGT2 Mohamad Rizuan Bin Amin first joined the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA) in 2008, he was posted to the Coastal Command (Singapore Cruise Centre) as a Primary Screening Officer conducting immigration clearance at the counter. Shortly after, he joined the Clearance Team, where he had the opportunity to go out to sea to clear crew onboard sea vessels. I also dealt with drugs, contraband, illegal immigrants, and other prohibited items. One of my biggest contraband cases to date was a joint operation with other agencies in 2012 at Jurong River. Each agency played a part in nabbing those involved in the smuggling from sea (smugglers) to land (handlers and distributors), and we managed to retrieve over 2,000 cartons of contraband cigarettes at the end.It was memorable as it was a unique experience, and I felt a sense of satisfaction being part of this operation. - SGT2 Rizuan, ICA.SGT2 Rizuan was posted to Tuas Checkpoint in 2018 and is currently taking on the role of a mentor for cargo clearance and a certified Image Analyst.: .....OneHomeTeam ImmigrationandCheckpointsAuthority GuardiansofOurBorders SecureBordersSafeSG

CI (2) Syed Aziz once had to deal with an aggressive subject who dashed through the immigration gates to evade immigration checks back when he was posted to Changi Airport.I was initially worried that the subject could be a major security threat, but as he seemed mentally troubled, I quickly transitioned into the role of a counsellor. Later, I understood that he was remanded at the Institute of Mental Health (IMH) and was assessed to be mentally unsound. After further investigations, he was eventually repatriated back to his home country. I am glad that the training I received as a para-counsellor in ICA has equipped me well to deal with such situations. - CI (2) Syed Aziz, Immigration & Checkpoints Authority.While such cases do not occur on a daily basis, it demonstrates the importance of empathy and communication that an ICA officer needs to have, in order to keep our borders safe and secure.CI (2) Syed Aziz is currently posted to Tuas Checkpoint as a Cargo Screening Officer where he ensures that dangerous and undesirable goods are not allowed to enter Singapore.: .....OneHomeTeam ImmigrationAndCheckpointsAuthority SecureBordersSafeSG GuardiansOfOurBorders

As the Commanding Officer of Lim Chu Kang Region, SUPT Ahamed Basha is committed to making his lessons memorable so that his officers can excel in their maritime Policing duties.We were on a three-day sailing trip to Brunei in 2015 when we experienced the full force of the northeast monsoon winds. The seas were very rough and this tested the endurance of our crew. I was really impressed by the Trainees as they rose to the challenge, applied the knowledge and skills that wed taught them and remained mission-focused throughout the voyage. We arrived safely at port in Brunei and everyone who sailed on that trip wore the experience like a badge of honour.Moments like these are why I love being an officer. The essence of training is to prepare our officers to respond effectively in a worst-case scenario, so that theyre well-equipped to uphold Singapores safety and security. - SUPT Basha,.....OneHomeTeam SingaporePoliceForce SafeguardingEveryday TrainingAndLearning

The vaccination exercise for Home Team officers involved in frontline healthcare operations started this morning (11 January 2021).The first Home Team healthcare frontliner vaccinated was Warrant Officer 1 Mohamed Shafiee Bin Jamin, 38. WO1 Shafiee is an Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF) paramedic from Kallang Fire Station whose role involves responding to day-to-day medical emergencies.Other Home Team healthcare frontliners vaccinated today include LTC Janice Oh, 42. LTC Oh is a Senior Assistant Director from SCDFs EMS Department. In addition to planning the policies and exercises for the EMS team including the COVID-19 response and vaccination exercise, LTC Oh is also involved in frontline paramedic duties.A total of 1,050 officers from the 's Emergency Medical Services (EMS) officers, staff from the Home Team Medical Services Division, and other frontline officers from the and Singapore Prison Service will be progressively vaccinated over the coming weeks.

ICAs new Integrated Services Centre will have a 24/7 operating floor equipped with self-service kiosks. A new system, iSMART, will store documents securely through the use of robotics and conveys documents on-demand to self-service kiosks for issuance. This will provide greater flexibility and convenience for ICA customers to collect documents beyond usual office operating hours and shorten transaction times for the collection of each document to no more than 15 minutes. ICAWPS2019 GuardiansOfOurBorders HTScienceAndTech
